title: No pope elected on first day, black smoke emerges from Sistine Chapel
byline: Black smoke billowed from the chimney of the Sistine Chapel at 9 p.m. local time on Wednesday, confirming that Catholic cardinals have failed to elect a new pope in the first round of voting at the papal conclave.

title: India captain Rohit retires from Test duty
byline: India captain Rohit Sharma has retired from Test cricket but will continue to play one-day internationals.

title: Will Work with All Opposition Parties to Ensure Transparent Local Governance: Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa yesterday said his party, the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), will respect the people’s verdict and cooperate with other opposition parties to ensure transparent and effective service delivery through local bodies where the opposition holds a majority.

title: No regulator, no data, no monitoring in SL’s lubricant sector
byline: Sri Lanka’s lubricant industry remains without a dedicated regulatory framework over a year, since the formal plans were first announced.

title: EU reminds Sri Lanka of GSP+ conditions
byline: The European Union (EU) has reiterated the urgency for Sri Lanka to align its domestic laws with the international human rights and labour conventions, if it is to continue reaping the benefits of preferential access to the EU market, under the GSP+ trade scheme.

title: UNP loses CMC after more than 50 years
byline: The United National Party (UNP) has lost the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) after more than 50 years as per the results of the 2025 Local Government elections, which are being released now.

title: Samantha Ranasinghe sworn in as MP
byline: Samantha Ranasinghe was sworn in as the National People’s Power (NPP) MP for the Kegalle District before Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne today.

title: 12 injured in van-container collision near Southern Expressway entrance
byline: At least 12 people were injured when a van collided with a parked container truck on the Matara-Akuressa main road, near the Palatuwa entrance to the Southern Expressway.

title: World Bank grants Sri Lanka $1.0bn loan
byline: Sri Lanka has been granted a billion-dollar loan to boost its agriculture, tourism and energy sectors, the World Bank said on Wednesday, as the country emerges from an unprecedented economic crisis.

title: NPP rules out joining opposition parties to form councils: Tilvin
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) will not join hands with opposition parties rejected by the people to establish councils whereas the NPP will consider independent groups or individuals who are willing to work with the NPP, JVP General Secretary Tilvin Silva said yesterday.

title: Protest over girls’ suicide causes traffic chaos
byline: Traffic along Duplication Road has been severely disrupted due to a protest, Police said.

title: No immediate increase in power tariffs: Minister
byline: There will be no immediate increase in power tariffs, Minister of Power and Energy Kumara Jayakodi told Parliament today.

title: New Commissioner General of Examinations appointed
byline: Subhashini Indika Kumari Liyanage has been appointed as the new Commissioner General of Examinations, effective immediately.

title: FR petition filed to invalidate Sri Lanka-India MoUs
byline: A Fundamental Rights petition has been filed before the Supreme Court, seeking an order to invalidate the Memoranda of Understanding (MoU) recently signed between Sri Lanka and India.

title: Rajagiriya motor accident case: SC dismisses Champika’s appeal
byline: The Supreme Court today dismissed an appeal petition filed by former Parliamentarian Patali Champika Ranawaka in connection with the indictment filed over the Rajagiriya motor accident case before the Colombo High Court.

title: SriLankan Airlines suspends flights to Lahore
byline: In light of the escalating tensions between India and Pakistan, SriLankan Airlines has announced the immediate suspension of all flights to Lahore, Pakistan.

title: Blast heard in Pakistan’s Lahore amid tensions with India
byline: A blast was heard in Pakistan’s eastern city of Lahore on Thursday morning, according to broadcaster Geo TV and a Reuters witness, a day after Indian strikes at multiple locations in the country and fears of an escalation in conflict between the nuclear-armed neighbours.

title: No barrier to forming councils without majority – EC
byline: In the recently concluded Local Government Election, it’s not a barrier to form an administration where there is no majority, said Commissioner General of Elections, Saman Sri Ratnayake.

title: RW spent Rs 1.27 billion for foreign tours during his tenure as President
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has spent Rs. 1.27 billion on 23 foreign tours from 2022 to 2024, Chief Government Whip Nalinda Jayatissa told Parliament today.

title: Issue with other inmates led to death inside remand prison: Minister
byline: The suspect who died recently while in remand prison has had issues with fellow inmates, Minister of Justice Harshana Nanayakkara told Parliament today.

title: WB President’s visit unlocks US $ 1bn support package for SL
byline: Sri Lanka is set to gain renewed momentum going forward with the World Bank (WB) announcing it will back the island nation with a support package in excess of US $ 1 billion.

title: Black smoke on second round of voting, no pope elected
byline: Black smoke billows from the chimney above the Sistine Chapel, meaning the 133 Cardinal electors have not yet chosen a new Pope.

title: Cabinet approves study on Independent Prosecutor’s Office
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved a proposal by the Minister of Justice and National Integration to appoint a technical specialist committee to study the establishment of an independent Public Prosecutor’s Office in Sri Lanka.

title: Maths teacher transferred, explanation sought from Ramanathan Hindu Ladies’ College principal
byline: The Education Minister has decided to question the school principal and transfer the male teacher involved, in response to the recent suicide of a Grade 10 schoolgirl in Kotahena.

title: SriLankan Airlines’ Cargo leads South Asia with IATA battery transport approval
byline: SriLankan Airlines’ cargo division has become the first airline in South Asia to receive approval from the International Air Transport Association (IATA) to transport lithium and sodium-ion batteries.

title: Pakistan says it downed 25 Indian drones after attacks escalate tensions
byline: Pakistan’s military says it shot down 25 Indian drones that entered its airspace, as hostilities between the nuclear-armed neighbours continue to spiral following Indian air raids on multiple locations within Pakistan’s territory.

title: Woman lures men online, robbed in jungle: Four arrested
byline: Four suspects, including a woman who had maintained relationships with several young men through social media, have been arrested for luring victims to jungle areas in Mihinthale, where they were assaulted and robbed.

title: Businessman nabbed with brand new mobile phones worth Rs. 10 Million
byline: A businessman was arrested with a stock of brand new mobile phones worth Rs. 10 million at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) while attempting to smuggle them into the country.

title: Vietnamese Buddhist Society funded private jet: Vijitha
byline: Heated arguments erupted in Parliament when Opposition MP Harshana Rajakaruna questioned the government as to who bore the expenses for the private jet for President Anura Kumara Dissanayake to return from Vietnam.

title: Thousands of children suffer from Thalassemia
byline: Health authorities have sounded the alarm over the growing burden of Thalassemia in Sri Lanka, with thousands of children affected and hundreds of thousands unknowingly carrying the gene for the disorder.

title: Second day of conclave begins to elect the next pope
byline: The second day of the conclave to elect a new pope began on Thursday, as 133 Catholic cardinals are re-entering the Sistine Chapel, where the secret balloting is held.

title: Sri Lanka closely monitoring developing situation in India, Pakistan: Nalinda
byline: The Foreign Ministry is closely monitoring the developing situation in India and Pakistan and is constantly updating the government, Cabinet Spokesman Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Sri Lanka sees unprecedented 14.5% surge in cash in 2024
byline: The Central Bank has reported an unprecedented 14.5 percent year-on-year (YoY) growth in physical cash circulation during 2024.

title: Bangladesh to adopt Sri Lankan model for dengue elimination
byline: Bangladesh is set to implement the Sri Lankan model to combat and eliminate dengue.

title: Immigration nabs 34 overstaying Bangladeshi nationals from Seeduwa
byline: A group of over 30 Bangladeshi nationals who were overstaying their tourist visas was taken into custody by the Department of Immigration and Emigration officials who raided a guesthouse in Seeduwa this afternoon.

title: Deshabandhu summoned before Parliamentary Committee of Inquiry
byline: Suspended Inspector General of Police Deshabandhu Tennakoon has been summoned to appear before the Parliamentary Committee of Inquiry investigating his conduct, on May 19.

title: MP Ramanathan Archchuna ordered to be removed from chamber
byline: Independent MP Ramanathan Archchuna was ordered to be removed from Parliament for continuous misbehaviour by presiding member Aravinda Senarath today.

title: Special trains for Vesak and long holidays
byline: Special train services have been arranged for four days for the convenience of commuters during the upcoming long weekend and for the State Vesak Festival, the Railways Department announced.

title: ’Gehenu Lamai’ selected for Cannes Classics at 78th Festival de Cannes
byline: The landmark 1978 Sinhala-language film Gehenu Lamai (Girls), directed by the late Dr. Sumitra Peries, has been officially selected for the prestigious Cannes Classics section at the 78th Festival de Cannes.

title: Kotahena sexual abuse suspect is NPP organiser, Says Namal
byline: The maths teacher who is accused of sexually abusing a child in Kotahena is a NPP organiser for Colombo Central, SLPP MP Namal Rajapaksa said today.

title: PSL matches shifted to Karachi amid rising Pakistan-India tensions
byline: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) on Thursday announced that the remaining matches of the Pakistan Super League (PSL) will be relocated to Karachi due to escalating tensions between Pakistan and India.
